content: I am working on task GF#12520. It says "1.) Usage of Wildcard parameter needs example. 2.) Are Wildcards supported for the first part of the parameter as well? e.g.: &_include:recurse=*:*:Practitioner"
but actually the reference to wildcard is a dangling reference that I forgot to remove when we changed the _include syntax for DSTU2.
I should remove the reference to wildcard, and not try and document some wildcard parameter.
in the long term, you need wildcard functionality here, you need the new GraphDefinition resource, but I can't change to mention that since it won't be in R3
Have we decided we're going to pull GraphDefinition?
we didn't decide that we were going to approve it, so we don't get to have any decision about pulling it or not. it has to be
Actually, we can pull something like that during the QA period so long as nothing is referencing it.
nothing is right now. but why not pull it before?
in fact, if we weren't going to pull it, it would be nice to mention it in _include
The reason to not pull it before is that it's not clear to me we have to pull it. If we get WG and FMG approval, it could stay.
